headline: Why Cadence Design Systems Stock Crushed It on Thursday
summary: Chip-making equipment specialist Cadence Design Systems (NASDAQ: CDNS) was targeted for a recommendation upgrade on Thursday, and investors eagerly leapt into the stock.  The company behind the upgrade was American banking powerhouse JPMorgan Chase.  The bank also cranked the price target higher to $325 per share from the preceding $300.

headline: Cadence, DocuSign, Health Catalyst, UiPath, and Amplitude Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after stocks extended their rebound, led by strong gains in the technology sector, as renewed optimism surrounding U.S.–China trade negotiations lifted investor sentiment.

headline: JPM upgrades Cadence, sees over 20% upside amid strong chip design trends
summary: Investing.com -- JP Morgan upgraded Cadence Design (NASDAQ:CDNS) Systems to "Overweight" from "Neutral" amid the recent stock underperformance. It notes a rising demand for chip design tools that position the company for consistent outperformance and more than 20% upside to its new price target.
